Package lab4.cscd211methods

Class CSCD211Lab4Methods

  • java.lang.Object
    • lab4.cscd211methods.CSCD211Lab4Methods
  • public class CSCD211Lab4Methods
extends Object
    The methods class for the Lab 4 methods that you must write
    This methods class contains methods for working with ArrayLists.
    NOTE:
    you will need to use Double.valueOf at key places you will lose massive points if the compiler displays
    Note: lab4/cscd211methods/CSCD211Lab4Methods.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
    Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.

      • addNum

        public static void addNum​(ArrayList<Double> myAList,
                          Scanner kb)
        The addNum method prompts the user to enter a number that is between 0 and 100 inclusive. The method ensures the number is between 0 and 100 inclusive. Once a proper number is received that number is added to the ArrayList
        Parameters:
        myAList - Representing the array list
        kb - - Representing the Scanner Object
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the Scanner object or the array list is null
        Post.:
        The ArrayList will be modified in place and trimmed to size

      • computeMean

        public static double computeMean​(ArrayList<Double> myAList)
        The computeMean calculates the mean value of the array list. The mean is average of the values in the array. Total the array list of numbers. Divide by the size. You cannot produce a mean from an empty array list
        Parameters:
        myAList - Representing the array list
        Returns:
        double - Representing the mean
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the array list is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the array list size is 0

      • computeMedian

        public static double computeMedian​(ArrayList<Double> myAList)
        The computeMean calculates the median value of the ArrayList. The median is the “middle value” of a sorted ArrayList, you must first sort your array list from lowest value to highest. The calculation for a median is different for an ArrayList of even length versus an array list of an odd size.
        An array list with an odd size.
        Find the index of the middle element
        Compute middle index with size divided by 2.
        The median would be the value at this array list index.

        An ArrayList with an even size.
        There will be two middle values.
        Compute index #1 with array list length divided by 2.
        Compute index #2 with index #1 - 1.
        Get the values stored at index #1 and index #2.
        The median is the two values added together and divided by 2. (recall we are doing int arithmetic) Divide by the size.
        Parameters:
        myAList - Representing the array list
        Returns:
        double Representing the median
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the array list is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the array list size is 0
        Pre.:
        You cannot produce a median from an empty array list

      • computeMidpoint

        public static double computeMidpoint​(ArrayList<Double> myAList)
        The computeMidpoint calculates the midpoint value of the ArrayList. The midpoint is the mean of the smallest and largest values in your array list.
        Sort your array list in ascending order.
        Retrieve the values from the beginning and end of the array list.
        The midpoint is those two values added together and divided by 2.
        Parameters:
        myAList - Representing the array list
        Returns:
        double Representing the midpoint
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the array list is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the array list size is 0
        Pre.:
        You cannot produce a midpoint from an empty array list

      • computeStandardDeviation

        public static double computeStandardDeviation​(ArrayList<Double> myAList)
        The computeStandardDeviation calculates the amount of variation form the average
        Compute the mean of the ArrayList
        Create a new ArrayList of deviations by subtracting the mean from each member from the original ArrayList.
        Square each member of the deviations ArrayList.
        Total those squared deviations.
        Divide by one less than the original ArrayList size. The standard deviation is the square root of this number.
        Parameters:
        myAList - Representing the array list
        Returns:
        double - Representing the midpoint
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the array list is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the array list size is 0
        Pre.:
        You cannot produce a midpoint from an empty array list

      • deleteValue

        public static void deleteValue​(ArrayList<Double> myAList,
                               Scanner kb)
        The deleteValue prompts the user for a value that may be in the array list and removes the item from the array list. The entered value must be between 0 and 100 inclusive The removed item is printed to the screen or the value does not exist
        Parameters:
        myAList - Representing the array list
        kb - Representing the Scanner object
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the array list or the Scanner is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the size of the array list is less than 1
        Pre.:
        The ArrayList must contain at least 1 item for the list to be modified - If the ArrayList does not contain 1 item the ArrayList is not modified
        NOTE: You must use an if statement to enforce the precondition properly

        if(myAList.size() = 0)
        return

        will earn 0 points for this method!
        Post.:
        The ArrayList will be modified in place and trimmed to size if the precondition was met

      • deleteValueByIndex

        public static void deleteValueByIndex​(ArrayList<Double> myAList,
                                      Scanner kb)
        The deleteValueByIndex prompts the user for an index value and removes the item at that index from the array list. The entered index must be between 0 and the list size - 1
        Parameters:
        myAList - Representing the array list
        kb - Representing the Scanner object
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the array list or the Scanner is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the size of the array list is less than 1
        Pre.:
        The ArrayList must contain at least 1 item for the list to be modified - If the ArrayList does not contain 1 item the ArrayList is not modified
        NOTE: You must use an if statement to enforce the precondition properly

        if(myAList.size() = 0)
        return

        will earn 0 points for this method!
        Post.:
        The ArrayList will be modified in place and trimmed to size if the precondition was met

      • fillArrayList

        public static void fillArrayList​(int size,
                                 ArrayList<Double> myAList)
        The fillArrayList method fills the ArrayList with random Double values between 0 and 100 inclusive. You can either use Math.random or the Random class.
        Parameters:
        size - Representing the number of elements to fill the array list with
        myAList - Representing the array list
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the array list is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the size of the array list is less than 1
        Post.:
        The ArrayList will be modified in place and trimmed to size

      • menu

        public static int menu​(Scanner kb)
        The menu method guarantees that a menu choice between 1 and 9 inclusive is entered.
        The menu choices are:

        1) Add a value to the ArrayList
        2) Delete a value from the ArrayList (by value)
        3) Delete a value from the ArrayList (by index/location)
        4) Display the ArrayList
        5) Compute the mean of the ArrayList
        6) Compute the median of the ArrayList
        7) Compute the midpoint of the ArrayList
        8) Compute the standard deviation of the ArrayList
        9) Quit
        Parameters:
        kb - Representing the Scanner object to the keyboard
        Returns:
        int - Representing the menu choice guaranteed by you the programmer to be between 1 and 9 inclusive
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the Scanner fin is null
        Post.:
        You must ensure the input buffer is empty at the end of the method.

      • printArrayList

        public static void printArrayList​(ArrayList<Double> myAList)
        The printArrayList prints the contents of the list out in the following format [#, #, #] (This is the standard format when printing an ArrayList object) or empty list if the list size is 0
        Parameters:
        myAList - Representing the array list
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the array list or the Scanner is null

        public static void printResults​(String type,

        Parameters:

        value - Representing the value to be printed

        Parameters:
        kb - Representing the Scanner Object
        Returns:
        int - Representing the entered numbered that will be greater than 0
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the Scanner object is null
